alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 5:56PM MDT until further notice by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Duck Creek, South Fork Republican River, East Spring Creek, East Branch Spring Creek, SF Republican, Buffalo Creek, Spring Creek, Sand Creek and Mud Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flagler and Seibert. Also the Flagler reservoir area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
